definitions.text: the property of being extremely abundant

examples: they studied forerunners of richness or poverty
the richness all around unsettled him for he had expected to find poverty

definitions.text: the property of a sensation that is rich and pleasing
examples: the music had a fullness that echoed through the hall
the cheap wine had no body, no mellowness
he was well aware of the richness of his own appearance

definitions.text: the quality of having high intrinsic value
examples: the richness of the mines and pastureland
the cut of her clothes and the richness of the fabric were distinctive

definitions.text: the property of producing abundantly and sustaining vigorous and luxuriant growth
examples: he praised the richness of the soil

definitions.text: a strong deep vividness of hue
examples: the fire-light gave a richness of coloring to that side of the room

definitions.text: splendid or imposing in size or appearance
examples: impressed by the richness of the flora
